explain: Ben Stokes has a reputation for being a fiery player and is known for his aggressive behavior in the England cricket team.

Ben Stokes had clashed with West Indies cricketer Marlon Samuels during the second Test of England's tour of the West Indies in April 2015. The incident occurred when Stokes mocked Samuels for continuously leaving the crease while taking guard, as well as for his batting technique. This led to a heated argument between the two players, resulting in the dismissal of Stokes who was subsequently fined 30 percent of his match fee by the ICC for his actions.

According to the given aspect, Ben Stokes responded positively after talking to England coach Peter Moores. This means that during their conversation, Moores was able to help Stokes see things in a more positive light and approach the situation in a more constructive way.

England needs to carefully manage Ben Stokes' aggression as it is an important aspect of his personality but it should be controlled to avoid any negative consequences during the ongoing Ashes series.
The given aspect suggests that Ben Stokes can be feisty and fiery in a natural way, but he should not let his emotions get the better of him.
In order to hit his full potential, England wants Ben Stokes to have the right mindset and approach when it comes to his performance on the field.

The core idea of this aspect is that if Ben Stokes or Craig Overton are playing in the Cricket team, then the team might consider playing two spinners in the lineup, which would increase the chances of playing both of them.
One core idea of the given aspect is that England wants to maximize the amount of cricket that they play, in order to give as many of their players as much game time as possible.
